intro: Corydalis khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
